sub_title: The creative behind multiple million-dollar product launches | The guy you go to when your own marketing videos make you cringe
summary: I am not your average creative professional. Along with being able to tell compelling stories through video, I am also a project manager, community builder, and a team leader. My passion for storytelling is complemented with a drive for big-picture planning and daily operational management in a multi-cultural environment.

profile_positions.description:
Leading a team dedicated to producing world-class, authentic, uplifting, and 'edutaining' content that delights and serves Mindvalley's bottomline. 

▸ Established an entirely new creative department for Mindvalley's marketing wing, responsible for delivering videos and creative collaterals for advertising campaigns, product launch campaigns, and social media content. 

 ▸ Grew the team from 4 people to a department of 15 of highly talented individuals, consisting of creative strategists, video producers, and copywriters; along with regularly liaising with the internal design wing of the company.
profile_positions.title: Head of Marketing Creatives

profile_positions.description:
▸ Led and managed a 4-member team of video producers
 ▸ Led a growth from 6.5 million monthly organic video views to 24 million monthly organic video views across social media platforms (FB, IG, YT)  in 3 months
 ▸ Along with viral video content, the team also produced videos for product launch campaigns 

Some Highlights:

 ▸ Conceptualized, directed, and edited a 35M+ views grossing video on Coca-Cola that went viral in multiple languages on FB, IG, YT, and even Whatsapp. ( fb.watch/bMqS5sU7zd/ )
 ▸ Conceptualized, directed, and edited a video for Mindvalley's Wildfit program that went viral multiple times on Reddit and 9Gag, along with FB and IG, and accidentally became one of Mindvalley's most profitable ads ever ( youtu.be/zDgmUtO8aUA )

As a result of executing a consistent viral video strategy and executing on highly creative and brand value-aligned topics, we not only contributed to the overall growth in the reach of Mindvalley's social media channels but also managed to have a subsequent effect in bringing the cost down for advertising.
profile_positions.title: Lead - Viral Video Content

profile_positions.description:
Mindvalley is a learning experience company that publishes ideas and teachings by the best authors in personal growth, wellbeing, spirituality, productivity, mindfulness and more – and combines them with cutting-edge sophisticated learning technology within engaged and supportive communities.

As a Video Content Producer and Campaign Manager, my responsibilities include managing the production of video assets for social media campaigns and product launches, wearing various hats as a producer, writer, director and editor for different projects.
profile_positions.title: Video Content Producer

profile_positions.description:
Direct event videography with an on-site films crew and single - handedly conceptualize and edit daily recap videos and after movies for the 3-day personal transformation event.

All videos below are same-day edits edited in 6 hours or less.
profile_positions.title: Director Of Video Production

profile_positions.description:
A marketing agency specialising in live events, ACG rapidly scales the audience of both physical events and symbolic periods of time, from conferences to brand launches. 

With Abedin Consultancy Group, I was the creative lead on the Reed Smith account, as a part of which we produced a film series for the global launch of their flagship initiative.
profile_positions.title: Creative Lead

profile_positions.description:
World Merit is an international charity partnered with the United Nations to empower young people with opportunities to tackle the Sustainable Development Goals.

Leading World Merit's communications and media efforts around the globe, the role encompasses campaigns, production, and strategy, utilizing the limited resources of a charity to leverage a global audience. Over the last year, this has led to successive campaigns that have further strengthen the growing World Merit community.
profile_positions.title: Head of Communications & Media

profile_positions.description:
Global responsible for directing AIESEC's marketing strategy across the global network of 128 countries and territories. My responsibilities majorly included improving the customer experience & journey for our products, executing brand strategy across the entire network, training and coaching the marketing heads across the global association, executing content and social media strategy and devising various campaigns.

This was also the year we got the 1 millionth sign up on our international exchange portal. 

- Led a team of 3 on the global executive body which involved digital marketing and public relations - executed elaborate marketing strategies with limited budget
- Led the change management for improving and adapting to digitalisation of our customer experience : co- designed the new customer journey as well as rolled it out to the network, and hosted trainings. Co-designed the B2B experience.
- Led the brand refresh process for AIESEC and its products through a task force and virtual participation of over 20 people
- Created the Youth For Global Goals brand for the pioneering campaign aimed at involving youth towards the sustainable development goals
- Implemented a more focused content strategy for social media, with focus on video content. 
- Growth in social media in the year: 20% on FB, 44% on LinkedIn, established IG channel, 55% in youtube subscribers, 142% user growth on the global website
- Responsible for internal communication initiatives and campaigns. Launched a weekly online QnA series to establish link between the global team and every member of the network
- Awarded by WorldBlu as the most democratic workplace 10 times in a row
- Organised and delivered 4 international conferences - in India, Morocco, Bulgaria and Portugal. Also part of the organising team of the AIESEC Youth Action Summit at the United Nations HQ in New York
- Executed YouthSpeak Campaign making 16 million impressions with more than 160000 responses from across the world
profile_positions.title: Global Head of Marketing

profile_positions.description:
- Led the 4000 member network of the 25 chapters of AIESEC India through the national executive team of 16 members comprising of 4 different nationalities
- Aligned the national brand of products to the global brand. Evolved content strategy for social media.
- Introduced various leadership development initiatives for the members along with improved HR practices. Increased the retention rate from 33% to more than 65% in a year
- Pioneered tech solutions that helped in increasing productivity and establishing proper customer feedback-product improvement loop
- Increased financial reserves by 30%, invested in the organising of International Conference 2015 to be hosted in second half of 205 in Delhi, and ended the year on a profit
- Represented India in 4 International Conferences in Taiwan, Mainland of China, Malaysia and Cambodia; and chaired a national conference in Indonesia
- Member of the Global Strategic Steering Team : Contributed to shaping of and feedbacking on global implementation of organisational strategies
- Delivered various national conferences all over the country to drive performance, deliver training and boost culture in the national association
- Executed various other initiatives such as Indo-Pak Project, Expansion into Nepal and Bangladesh
- Spoke at StartAP Fest in Vizag in 2014 : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cjPHlTHS7GA
profile_positions.title: Country Director

profile_positions.description:
- Managed and executed financial strategy of the National Association, overall budget of EUR 660000
- Deployed a new internal financial model in the national association : led the change management process. The new model ultimately made the state of the association more profitable
- Virtually managed and trained the finance heads of all the indian local chapters
- Introduced improvements in accounting practices in the whole association leading to better legality implementation and financial manegement
profile_positions.title: National Head of Finance

profile_positions.description:
- Led the 100 member strong local committee through an executive team of 14 people, managing more than 60 stakeholders and a budget of more than EUR 150,000
- Rejuvenated the brand of the organisation in the city through university relations, purpose-driven events and refreshing the organisation culture
- Increased volunteer retention rate to beyond 75% (as against 40%) in the previous year, through evolved recruitment and induction strategies, innovative people development programs and maintaining a growth-oriented and enjoyable culture
- Financial state brought back on track by paying off a debt of beyond EUR 14,000 to the national association in a 9 month period
- Sustained operations despite initial hiccups on the financial, HR and branding front
- Awarded by the National Association for innovations in Communications and Information Management, as well as for growth in the Global Talent Program.
profile_positions.title: Managing Director

profile_positions.description:
- Established and managed 4 expansion units: 2 city-based and 2 university-based
- Delivered training and coaching to expansion executive teams
- 40% contribution to overall local chapter operations and revenue
The two city-based exapansions - namely Patiala and Dehradun, went on to become permanent local chapters in the coming years
profile_positions.title: Head of Expansions (Local Chapter)

profile_positions.description:
-Executed financial strategy for a 100 member strong local chapter managing a budget of more than EUR 120,000, ending the year in profit
- Awarded Best Local Chapter in Finance in the national association
profile_positions.title: Head of Finance (Local Chapter)

volunteer_experiences.role: Volunteer - Project Break Up The Barriers
volunteer_experiences.description: Assisted and taught special children in a local school the Kocaeli local chapter of AIESEC Turkey had partnered with. This was part of the global community development program AIESEC offered for students in their under-graduation period.

Worked and lived at a transit refugee camp near Budapest. 
Assisted with interpretation between the authorities and refugees from Pakistan, Afghanistan, Bangladesh and India.
Delivered english classes to chinese refugees
Assisted the camp authorities with daily admin work
